title: Merge pull request #131 from sbaar/patch-1
message:
Merge pull request #131 from sbaar/patch-1

added min_width max_width to default values.xml

title: added min_width max_width to default values.xml
message:
added min_width max_width to default values.xml

This fixes a crash when calling 
SnackbarManager.show(snackbar,false) on devices where the smallest width is less than 600dp, such as the nexus 5. It would throw a resource not found exception because the only value specified for the resource is in values-sw600dp

Particularly, it would crash on line layout.setMinimumWidth(res.getDimensionPixelSize(dimen.sb__min_width)); in
 private MarginLayoutParams init(Context context, Activity targetActivity, ViewGroup parent, boolean usePhoneLayout)
of snackbar.java because it's being forced to use the tablet specific implementation when it would normally do so, namely when the width is less than 600dp on a device like the nexus 5 which is 360.0 dp x 592.0 dp

title: Merge pull request #108 from hatemsh/master
message:
Merge pull request #108 from hatemsh/master

Fix dismissByReplace jarring animation

title: Fix dismissByReplace jarring animation
message:
Fix dismissByReplace jarring animation

Separated the mAnimated field of Snackbar into 2 fields: mShowAnimated
and mDismissAnimated with each field having its own getter and setter
methods. withAnimation(boolean) will change both of these values and
isAnimated() will return true only if both of them are set to true.

In SnackBarManager when replacing a snackbar, dimissAnimation(false) is
called on the previous snackbar and showAnimation(false) is called on
the new snackbar. This provided much smoother visuals when dismissing by
replace.

title: .maxWidthPercentage(float width) method
message:
.maxWidthPercentage(float width) method

Adds the ability to set the desired width of the Snackbar on tablets. The maximum width of the message was set to
<dimen name="sb__max_width">568dp</dimen> in dimens.xml which was too narrow for me. I wanted to have a full-width message on the bottom of the tablet's screen.

Sample usage is:
Snackbar.with(getApplicationContext())
      .text("Message text")
      .maxWidthPercentage(0.95f)
      .show(this);

Added 2 new callbacks for EventListener: onShowByReplace and onDismissByReplace.

title: Disallow action btn to be clicked multiple times or when dismissing
message:
Disallow action btn to be clicked multiple times or when dismissing

Previously, the action button could be clicked multiple times (spam click while dismissing) which would result in the onActionClicked() callback being called multiple times. Considering the common uses of Snackbar, I feel like that should be undesired. Now, when the action button is clicked, it checks two things before calling the callback:

1) The snackbar is not dismissing
2) That it is the first time the button is being clicked unless multiple clicks are allowed (disabled by default)

title: Merge pull request #71 from hzsweers/master
message:
Merge pull request #71 from hzsweers/master

Add options for custom typeface and make recyclerview a provided dependency

title: Make RecyclerView a provided dependency
message:
Make RecyclerView a provided dependency

If a developer doesn't use it, then this becomes an unnecessary extra dependency that exists for the sole purpose of attaching to and dismissing when a recyclerview scrolls. By marking it provided (and moving some code around), we can make sure this there for the developers that need it without unnecessarily burdening other developers with it as a transitive dependency.

title: Merge pull request #43 from theknut/master
message:
Merge pull request #43 from theknut/master

Add bottom margin if content is fitting system ui

title: Add bottom margin if content is fitting system ui
message:
Add bottom margin if content is fitting system ui

If the content is fitting the system windows the snackbar gets animated behind the navigation bar. Therefore check if the measured height equals the bottom position of the content view. If it does add a the navigation bar height as bottom margin.

This is rough workaround, further checks need to be added if required.

This might resolve issue #41.

title: Merge pull request #37 from SteadfastInnovation/feature/event_listener_px
message:
Merge pull request #37 from SteadfastInnovation/feature/event_listener_px

Changed EventListener methods to take a Snackbar instance as the paramet...

title: Changed EventListener methods to take a Snackbar instance as the parameter.
message:
Changed EventListener methods to take a Snackbar instance as the parameter.

This allows users to:
- differentiate between Snackbar instances in common EventListener
  implementations
- get the width, height, and offset from the Snackbar in pixels (or any other
  relevant info about the Snackbar)

Also made sure that the width/height values are valid when onShow() is called
and prevented the dismiss listener from making the height of the Snackbar 0
before calling onDismiss() when swiping the Snackbar away (this logic was there
for swiping away list items, which a Snackbar is not).

message: Fixed the min/max width and offset for the tablet layout.

title: Removed bold style from action button.
message:
Removed bold style from action button.

The spec defines the action button to be Roboto Medium, however "bold" is
heavier than Roboto Medium for API < 21. Therefore the action button should just
be regular on API < 21.

title: Modified calls to onShow(height) and onDismiss(height) so they both occur when…
message:
Modified calls to onShow(height) and onDismiss(height) so they both occur when the action is starting and they both provide an exact height in pixels instead of a maximum height. This helps in implementing floating action buttons movement with respect to the snackbar as specified in the material guidelines.

Also removed some unneeded calls to dpToPx().

title: Changed in and out animations to follow the Material Design specs. Also renamed
message:
Changed in and out animations to follow the Material Design specs. Also renamed
animation resource files to snackbar_in and snackbar_out to make it less likely
for the parent project to accidently override the animations. Naming them
snackbar_in and snackbar_out also allows people to intentionally override them
with custom in and out animations.
